definition: (in former times) coming-of-age ceremony at 20 years
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to put on a hat/to be first/to dub

sentences.english: For even as love crowns you so shall he crucify you.
sentences.chinese: 愛雖給你加冠，他也要把你釘在十字架上。

sentences.english: The crowning glory for practical shooting is to become the IPSC World Champion.
sentences.chinese: 加冠的榮耀爲實用射擊將適合IPSC世界冠軍。

sentences.english: Alpine Canada, like the ancient officials crowns .
sentences.chinese: 加冠峯，似古代官員冠冕。

definition: to reach marriageable age (a girl's fifteenth birthday)
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
